revised_title: Sparrowhawk Predation Risk and Prey Selection in Breeding Passerine Birds
tldr: This study examines the predation risk and prey selection of sparrowhawks on passerine birds during the breeding season. The research focuses on factors such as body size, abundance, foraging behavior, and reproductive behavior of prey species. The findings provide insights into the impact of predation on the morphology, reproductive behavior, and other characteristics of prey species, and contribute to a better understanding of predation as a selection pressure in birds.
